sentence: The Procter & Gamble CompanyPG is set to report third-quarter fiscal 2015 results on Apr 23, before the market opens.
Last quarter, it delivered a positive earnings surprise of 7.02%.
Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.
P&G delivered 2% organic sales growth in the first half of fiscal 2015.
Management expects organic top-line trends to accelerate moderately in the second half given an improving U.S. market, easing comparisons and higher pricing to offset the currency impacts.
Moreover, lower commodity costs in the second half and productivity savings should result in meaningful improvement in core earnings per share compared with the first.
However, management expects significant currency headwinds to weigh on sales and earnings in the third as well as the fourth quarter of 2015.
Over the last few months, almost all foreign currencies have weakened versus the U.S. dollar compelling the company to lower its fiscal 2015 guidance twice.

In addition to significant negative Fx impact, market share erosion and lower consumption in several countries due to pricing action and macroeconomic headwinds in a number of key markets remain the challenges in the second half.
Our proven model does not conclusively show that P&G is likely to beat earnings this quarter.
That is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #1, 2 or 3 for this to happen.
That is not the case here, as you will see below.
Zacks ESP: The Earnings ESP for P&G is -1.08% as the Most Accurate estimate stands at 92 cents, lower than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 93 cents.
Zacks Rank: P&G's Zacks Rank #3 (Hold)increases the predictive power of ESP.
However, we need to have a positive ESP to be confident about an earnings surprise.
We caution against stocks with Zacks Ranks #4 and 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company is seeing negative estimate revisions momentum.

Some stocks in the broader consumer staples sector that have both a positive Earnings ESP and a favorable Zacks Rank are:

Treehouse Foods, Inc. THS , with an Earnings ESP of +1.72% and a Zacks Rank #3.
The Hain Celestial Group, Inc. HAIN , with an Earnings ESP of +2.22% and a Zacks Rank #3.
Tyson Foods, Inc. TSN , with an Earnings ESP of +2.7% and a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
